us.ihmc.euclid.referenceFrame.interfaces

Interface FramePose2DBasics

  • All Superinterfaces:
    us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, FixedFramePose2DBasics, FrameChangeable, FramePose2DReadOnly, Pose2DBasics, Pose2DReadOnly, ReferenceFrameHolder, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FramePose2D

    public interface FramePose2DBasics
extends FixedFramePose2DBasics, FrameChangeable
    Write and read interface for a 2D pose expressed in a changeable reference frame, i.e. the reference frame in which this pose is expressed can be changed.

    In addition to representing a Pose2DBasics, a ReferenceFrame is associated to a FramePose2DBasics. This allows, for instance, to enforce, at runtime, that operations on poses occur in the same coordinate system.

    Because a FramePose2DBasics extends Pose2DBasics, it is compatible with methods only requiring Pose2DBasics. However, these methods do NOT assert that the operation occur in the proper coordinate system. Use this feature carefully and always prefer using methods requiring FramePose2DBasics.

        Parameters:

      • setIncludingFrame

        default void setIncludingFrame(ReferenceFrame referenceFrame,
                               us.ihmc.euclid.transform.RigidBodyTransform rigidBodyTransform)
        Sets this pose 2D to match the given rigid-body transform and sets the reference frame.

        The given transform has to represent a 2D transformation.

        Parameters:
        referenceFrame - the new reference frame.
        rigidBodyTransform - the transform used to update the position and orientation. Not modified.
        Throws:
        us.ihmc.euclid.exceptions.NotAMatrix2DException - if the rotation part of the transform does not represent a 2D transformation.

      • setIncludingFrame

        default void setIncludingFrame(ReferenceFrame referenceFrame,
                               us.ihmc.euclid.transform.RigidBodyTransform rigidBodyTransform,
                               boolean checkIsTransform2D)
        Sets this pose 2D to match the given rigid-body transform and sets the reference frame.
        Parameters:
        referenceFrame - the new reference frame.
        rigidBodyTransform - the transform used to update the position and orientation. Not modified.
        checkIsTransform2D - indicates whether or not the method should check that the rotation part of the given transform represents a 2D rotation in the XY-plane.
        Throws:
        us.ihmc.euclid.exceptions.NotAMatrix2DException - if checkIsTransform2D is true and if the rotation part of the transform does not represent a 2D transformation.

      • setIncludingFrame

        default void setIncludingFrame(ReferenceFrame referenceFrame,
                               us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Tuple2DReadOnly position,
                               double yaw)
        Sets this pose 2D from the given position, yaw angle and sets the reference frame.
        Parameters:
        referenceFrame - the new reference frame.
        position - the tuple used to initialize this pose's position. Not modified.
        yaw - the angle used to initialize the pose's orientation.

      • setIncludingFrame

        default void setIncludingFrame(FrameTuple2DReadOnly position,
                               FrameOrientation2DReadOnly orientation)
        Sets position, orientation, and reference frame.
        Parameters:
        position - the tuple with the new position coordinates. Not modified.
        orientation - the orientation with the new angle value for this. Not modified.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if position and orientation are not expressed in the same reference frame.
